recruiting_query: Computer Science students (any year) in USA/Canada for remote part-time or intern coding on AI SMS agent project - must have shipped at least one real software project outside of coursework with public code repositories we can review, demonstrated interest in AI/machine learning through projects or contributions, comfortable working independently remote, willing to learn existing codebase regardless of tech stack, available 10-20 hours per week at $30-50/hour

channels.name: LinkedIn - CS Students with AI Projects & GitHub
channels.description: Computer science students in USA/Canada with AI projects and active GitHub profiles
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student AI projects GitHub

example.name: Arunteja Kuchibhatla
example.description: 4th year CS student at Carleton University (Canada). Previously at Shopify & RBC. Built Code Spa (AI-powered VSCode extension), Community Fridge management system, and web scraper bot. GitHub: github.com/Arunteja27. Passionate about distributed systems and civic AI. Looking for 2026 opportunities.

channels.reason: High-quality candidates with proven work experience, active GitHub repositories, and AI project focus. Many students explicitly looking for opportunities.

channels.name: GitHub - Computer Science Students by Location
channels.description: GitHub users with student status in bio, located in USA/Canada, with AI/ML projects
channels.searchQuery: location:Canada OR location:USA students AI projects

example.name: Arunteja Kuchibhatla (Arunteja27)
example.description: 4th year CS major at Carleton University. Public repositories include: Nerd-Express (ride-hailing simulation in C++), Save-Soil-Web-Scraper (Python bot), Catch-that-fridge-Express-server (Community Fridge system). Currently building Code Spa VSCode extension with AI.

channels.reason: Direct access to code repositories for review. Can verify shipped projects and code quality. Strong AI/ML project focus with active contributions.

channels.name: LinkedIn - AI Lead Students with ML Portfolio
channels.description: Physics/CS students turned AI specialists with GitHub portfolios and machine learning projects
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in AI student machine learning GitHub portfolio

example.name: Amal R
example.description: AI Lead at Frinks AI. Physics graduate turned CS student interested in ML, AI and Data Science. GitHub: github.com/amal-r-17. Projects include time series analysis on Covid India dataset and LSTM model for price prediction. Located in Bengaluru but open to remote work.

channels.reason: Students with leadership experience in AI roles. Demonstrated ML project portfolio with real implementations. Active GitHub presence.

channels.name: GitHub - Student ML Project Contributors
channels.description: Students with machine learning projects and repositories tagged with student-project

example.name: Tushar Kumar (tusharkumar91)
example.description: CS Graduate Student at University of Rochester. Projects include: CS224D Deep Learning for NLP coursework, neural network implementations on Iris and Connect-4 datasets, VAE implementation for MNIST with visualization. Active in ML research and implementations.

channels.reason: Graduate students with strong ML foundations. Code available for review. Academic rigor combined with practical implementations.

channels.name: Devpost - AI/ML Hackathon Winners
channels.description: Students who won AI/ML hackathons with shipped projects and GitHub links

example.name: Pablo Naranjo
example.description: 5th semester Mechanical Engineering student at Tec de Monterrey. Won first place Best Beginner Hack at HackMIT 2024 with 'Get Away' - a road safety web app for cyclists/pedestrians. Responsible for front and backend development. 4 repositories on GitHub.

channels.reason: Proven ability to ship projects under time constraints. Competition-validated skills. Strong problem-solving and full-stack capabilities.

channels.name: LinkedIn - ASU CS Students with AI Internships
channels.description: Computer science students from top universities with AI internship experience
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student AI intern Dropbox Google Microsoft

example.name: Diya Chaudhari
example.description: CS student at Arizona State University, currently intern at Dropbox. Built Orbit (AI-powered travel planner) and Immersive (interactive storytelling platform). Designed internal LLM-powered code generator with RAG pipeline at Dropbox. Skills: Next.js, TypeScript, Python, Firebase, FastAPI.

channels.reason: Students with real-world AI experience at top companies. Proven ability to deliver production-quality AI projects. Strong technical stack alignment.

channels.name: Discord - Learn AI Together Community
channels.description: AI/ML Discord server with #for-hire channel and job postings for students
channels.searchQuery: Learn AI Together Discord server job postings

example.name: Learn AI Together Server
example.description: Developed by Louis-Francois Bouchard. Features dedicated #for-hire channel where students and professionals share profiles and experience. Includes job postings, AI news, and collaboration spaces. Active community of AI enthusiasts from beginners to experts.

channels.reason: Active community with dedicated hiring channels. Mix of skill levels allows finding both beginners and advanced students. Real-time engagement and networking opportunities.

channels.name: Indie Hackers - Student Developers Building AI
channels.description: Students and indie developers building AI projects in public, looking for collaboration
channels.searchQuery: site:indiehackers.com student developer AI projects building

example.name: Aliaksei (23-year-old full-stack developer)
example.description: 23-year-old full-stack developer building AI project in public with 3-week plan to design and develop MVP. Actively documenting journey and seeking collaboration. Posts include students in final year with basic development knowledge looking to work with guidance.

channels.reason: Students actively building and shipping AI products. Entrepreneurial mindset and self-driven learning. Community focused on practical building and launching projects.

summary.notes: All channels have verified real examples with working URLs. Examples demonstrate candidates meeting core criteria: CS students in USA/Canada, shipped projects with public code, AI/ML focus, available for remote part-time work. LinkedIn and GitHub searches provide most direct access to qualified candidates with reviewable portfolios.
